description: From priest +‎ -ess. Compare Middle English preesteresse (“priestess”).

entries.meaning: A woman with religious duties and responsibilities in certain non-Christian religions.
examples: Synonyms: gythja, kahuna, mamaloi, mambo, miko

entries.meaning: (religious slur, uncommon) A female Christian priest or minister, typically in a Protestant, Old Catholic, or independent Catholic denomination.

verbs.description: priestess (third-person singular simple present priestesses, present participle priestessing, simple past and past participle priestessed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To oversee (a pagan ceremony, etc.) as priestess.
examples: Ye Ye Ife, a gifted feminist ritualist and priestess of Oshun from San Diego, trained in the Yoruba tradition, designed and priestessed the ritual with me.
